6ac4fef1-485c-4464-a15f-6e4be2d45040.description: The course objective is to present various Agile methods, tools and techniques, and best practices for how to determine if an Agile approach is the right choice for a project or agency, as well as best practices for how to plan and implement Agile project management. Prerequisite: Project Management Principles (Suggested).
6ac4fef1-485c-4464-a15f-6e4be2d45040.name: Agile Project Management for the Federal Government (6010)

badge_template_activities.title: The method of assessment is examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, classroom exercises, discussions, lectures, and practical exercises.

a586619e-fe89-43e9-8b5e-617dd2d987be.description: Students use discussions, exercises, integrated case studies, and presentations to resolve various situations with legal implications; apply a range of pricing techniques to develop a pre-negotiation objective; develop a negotiation strategy; conduct a negotiation; evaluate requests for equitable adjustment; manage contract performance; calculate final price and profit; and close out a contract. Prerequisites: ACQ 101; CLC 051; CLC 056; CLC 057; CON 200; CON 216; CON 270; and HBS 428
a586619e-fe89-43e9-8b5e-617dd2d987be.name: CON 290: Contract Administration and Negotiation Techniques in a Supply Environment (1290)(v.2)

1b6587b6-0f43-4169-a907-c00b4c5ce56b.description: The course objective is to provide students the opportunity to work through the seven steps of the services acquisition process as they prepare and review acquisition documents, develop and deliver source selection briefings, and negotiate contractual issues as part of a realistic, scenario-based case study that runs throughout the course. Prerequisites: ACQ 101; CON 200; CON 216; CLC 051; CLC 056; CON 270; and HBS 428
1b6587b6-0f43-4169-a907-c00b4c5ce56b.name: CON 280: Source Selection and the Administration of Service (1280)(v.2)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, written papers, and performance rubrics with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.

a2d76b27-6e7b-4691-ae56-7fee91e20429.description: The course objective is to work individually and in teams to practice developing sound business solutions as a valued strategic and expert business advisor. Students will learn to analyze complex contracting situations with emphasis on critical thinking, problem solving, research, and risk reduction. Student course work is designed to contribute real solutions on real acquisition problems to senior leadership and local supervisors. Prerequisite: FAC-C or DAWIA Level II Certification
a2d76b27-6e7b-4691-ae56-7fee91e20429.name: CON 360: Contracting for Decision Makers (1360)(v.2)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, presentations, written papers, and performance rubrics with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, classroom exercises, discussions, learner presentations, and lectures.

9dcaea89-1596-494b-ba93-f6ffd386505e.description: The course helps students become better business advisors in developing contract arrangements that are in the best interest of the government. It builds on the fundamental contract pricing principals covered in the Level I contracting curriculum, Contract Pricing Reference Guide and FAR policy. Students will be subjected to quantitative techniques and tools used to quantify and facilitate decision making in determining a fair and reasonable price. Prerequisites: CON 170; CLC 024; CLC 056
9dcaea89-1596-494b-ba93-f6ffd386505e.name: CON 270: Intermediate Cost and Price Analysis (1270)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, case studies, and performance rubrics with a minimum passing score of 80 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussions, case studies, learner presentations, and lectures.

086440f0-2afc-4b58-aaa0-0c473ded9eae.description: The course objective is to provide foundational knowledge of contract cost and price analysis and an opportunity for students to apply qualitative tools to accomplish cost and price analysis in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS), the DFARS Procedures, Guidance, and Information (PGI), and the Contract Pricing Reference Guide (CPRG). Prerequisites: CLC 057; CLC 058; CON 090; CON 127, CON 112 or FCN 112.

8da07819-0103-4b89-9d2c-652852696fbd.name: CON 243: Architect-Engineering Services Contracting (1032)(v.3)

Students will navigate the online FAR as they wrestle with realistic scenario-based contracting situations.
7856a1a2-b552-4d67-82a7-4122415db32c.name: FCN 190: FAR Fundamentals (1191)

b51c7fcf-234d-4798-be80-af55fe3b3e88.description: The course provides an overview of the federal acquisition process and addresses knowledge and skills necessary to execute the responsibilities of a contracting officer's representative (COR). Topics include COR delegation and responsibilities; ethics; acquisition planning; contract award; communication and documentation; monitoring performance; inspection, acceptance, and payment; modifications; improper contract changes; dealing with unsatisfactory performance; closeout.
b51c7fcf-234d-4798-be80-af55fe3b3e88.name: Contracting Officer's Representative Course (1070)(v.4)

8a9c5f71-2bf6-4d2a-ad4d-a342c0f96805.description: The course provides foundational knowledge of the simplified methods of procurement, as detailed in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). Topics include ethical considerations; planning for simplified acquisitions; required sources; buying through the general services administration; using open market sources; implementing small business preference programs; simplified acquisition ordering methods; additional considerations based on what is being bought; and administration and follow-up.
8a9c5f71-2bf6-4d2a-ad4d-a342c0f96805.name: Simplified Acquisition Procedures (1077)(v.4)

05f6b3ab-a70c-4471-820e-cbdc74ac2e17.description: The course objective is to provide an overview of government contract law, with special emphasis on laws and regulations relating to ethics, data rights, fiscal law, protests, and contract management. Through analysis of actual legal cases, this course provides acquisition professionals with a deeper understanding of how judicial decisions impact the acquisition process.
05f6b3ab-a70c-4471-820e-cbdc74ac2e17.name: ACQ 370: Acquisition Law (1370)(v.1)

ad175c18-18ad-42c8-9aa8-d62bf59057ae.name: CON244: Construction Contracting (1021)(v.3)

Prerequisite: CLC 013: Services Acquisition.

af1918fd-be14-45b3-a814-0497d29034b9.description: To provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage the procurement process through procurement planning; solicitation planning; solicitation; source selection; contract administration; and contract closeout.
af1918fd-be14-45b3-a814-0497d29034b9.name: Project Procurement Management (6126)(v.1)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, discussion, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

78770708-3d4a-4366-bad4-01e0856eba60.description: The course objective is to offer a proven method and current practice for incorporating risk management processes as integral elements of project management and provide different approaches to identify risks; qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze risks and determine their impacts; risk ranking and response techniques; and approaches to monitor, control, and communicate risks throughout the project life cycle.Project Management Principles (suggested).
78770708-3d4a-4366-bad4-01e0856eba60.name: Project Risk Management (6103)

f447dada-b707-4261-81f3-5dadd56ff18d.name: Project Risk Management (6103)(v.6)

00f7f22f-7a62-4904-a0c1-29d250a04bf2.description: The course objective is to provide students with knowledge and skills to manage multiple, complex projects and align results to organizational goals by managing program changes, risks, and challenges. Prerequisite: Project Management Principles.
00f7f22f-7a62-4904-a0c1-29d250a04bf2.name: Requirements Management for Project Managers (6134)

0201c9f0-9e8c-4f2f-98ac-70e71123ad31.description: The course objective is to provide information and skills to develop and manage project requirements and maximize the value delivered from all project and program investments resulting in project and program success.
0201c9f0-9e8c-4f2f-98ac-70e71123ad31.name: Requirements Management for Project Managers (6134)(v.3)

1cce59a5-6686-482e-bed6-db9f6d397372.description: The course objective is to provide the student with the knowledge and skills to make sound source selection decisions using negotiated contracting procedures as prescribed in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 15. The general course topics include source selection overview; source selection planning; developing evaluation factors; prepare and issue the solicitation; competitive range and discussions; and selection and award protests.
1cce59a5-6686-482e-bed6-db9f6d397372.name: Source Selection (1078)(v.4)

d950b915-406c-4137-a9f3-6e3266a9d31f.name: Writing Effective Budget Justifications Workshop (5120)(v.1)

2e98ca17-3e7f-4b28-bde1-ab911df793b2.name: Writing Performance Work Statements (1079)(v.1)
